skill.name: polars
skill.description: Fast DataFrame library (Apache Arrow). Select, filter, group_by, joins, lazy evaluation, CSV/Parquet I/O, expression API, for high-performance data analysis workflows.
skill.summary: Fast DataFrame library (Apache Arrow). Select, filter, group_by, joins, lazy evaluation, CSV/Parquet...
skill.author: K-Dense Inc.

security_audit.summary: Documentation-only skill with Polars usage examples and best practices. No code execution, file access, or network behavior present beyond illustrative snippets.

content.user_title: Analyze data faster with Polars workflows
content.value_statement: Large datasets can be slow and memory heavy in pandas. This skill shows Polars expressions, lazy queries, and fast I O for efficient analysis.
actual_capabilities: Explain Polars expressions for select, filter, and with_columns
Guide group_by aggregations and window functions
Show joins, concat, pivot, and unpivot patterns
Provide CSV, Parquet, JSON, and Excel I O workflows
Map common pandas operations to Polars equivalents
limitations: Does not execute code or access user data
No pandas index features or advanced pandas ecosystem tools
Streaming is limited to supported operations
Custom Python UDFs can reduce performance

use_cases.title: Speed up reporting
use_cases.description: Convert slow pandas reports to Polars with lazy queries and better I O.

use_cases.title: Optimize pipelines
use_cases.description: Design efficient Polars pipelines with pushdown and streaming guidance.

use_cases.title: Migrate safely
use_cases.description: Translate pandas patterns to Polars with clear syntax mappings.

prompt_templates.title: Basic filtering
prompt_templates.prompt: Show how to read a CSV with Polars and filter rows where age is over 30, then select name and age.

prompt_templates.title: Group by summary
prompt_templates.prompt: Provide a Polars group_by example to compute total sales and average order value by region.

prompt_templates.title: Lazy pipeline
prompt_templates.prompt: Create a lazy Polars pipeline that scans Parquet, filters by date, selects columns, and collects with streaming.

prompt_templates.title: Pandas migration
prompt_templates.prompt: Rewrite this pandas chain in Polars: filter active users, add a revenue column, group by plan, and compute mean revenue.

output_examples.input: Explain how to join two tables and then pivot by month in Polars.
output: Describe the join type and keys to use
Show a join followed by a group_by and pivot outline
Note when to aggregate before pivoting
Mention performance tips like filtering early

best_practices: Use lazy scan functions for large files to enable pushdown
Select only needed columns early in the pipeline
Prefer expression API over Python UDFs for speed
anti_patterns: Reading large files with eager read_csv
Row iteration or heavy map_elements in hot paths

faq.question: What environments are supported?
faq.answer: Any Python environment with Polars installed, including notebooks and scripts.

faq.question: Are there limits on data size?
faq.answer: Performance depends on memory, but lazy and streaming help with large datasets.

faq.question: Can it integrate with databases?
faq.answer: Yes, via Polars database readers or connectorx, as shown in the guides.

faq.question: Does it access my data?
faq.answer: No, it provides guidance only and does not read files or send data.

faq.question: What if my query is slow?
faq.answer: Use lazy mode, filter early, and check the optimized plan with explain.

faq.question: How does it compare to pandas?
faq.answer: Polars is faster for many workloads and supports lazy optimization, but pandas has broader ecosystem support.
